intro: Eudianthe, commonly known as the fairy siffling or siffling bell, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Primulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically feature showy, bell-shaped flowers that are often pink or white in color. Eudianthe species are herbaceous perennials, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Their foliage is characterized by ovate to elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
